passages.text: China (PRC) | Internet Alibaba
Impressive Set of Results and Outlook Across Segments

BABA reported a solid set of Jun quarter results (link). During conference call, management highlights synergies with Quick Commerce and UE improvement on optimization in user structure, order mix and fulfillment efficiencies. For Cloud, it maintains accelerating growth on rising AI adoption with enhanced modeling capabilities and strong inference/ training demands. We expect BABA reaches a new milestone and captures next phase of growth ahead. Maintain Buy

Jun quarter results highlights. Total revenue grew \(2\%\) YoY to RMB248bn, \(2.2\%\) and \(1.8\%\) below consensus and our estimate respectively. By segment, Alibaba China E- commerce Group grew by \(10\%\) YoY to RMB140bn (vs our estimate at about RMB139bn). For China ecommerce business, revenue increased by \(9\%\) YoY to RMB118.6bn, among which CMR grew \(10\%\) YoY (vs consensus and our estimates at \(10.5\%\) YoY). For Alibaba International Digital Commerce Group (AIDC), revenue grew at \(19\%\) YoY (vs consensus and our estimates at \(20\%\) YoY) to RMB34.7bn. For Cloud Intelligence Group, revenue grew \(26\%\) YoY (vs consensus and our estimates at \(21\%\) and \(23\%\) YoY, respectively) to RMB33.4bn. All Others revenue declined by \(28\%\) YoY to RMB58.6bn (vs our estimate at RMB63bn). Overall adjusted EBITA declined by \(14\%\) YoY to RMB38.8bn (in line with our estimate). Adjusted EBITA margin declined by 3pp YoY to \(16\%\) (vs our estimate at \(15\%\) ). For Alibaba China E- commerce Group, segment adjusted EBITA declined \(21\%\) YoY (vs our estimate of \(20\%\) YoY decline) to RMB38.4bn. For Alibaba Cloud, segment adjusted EBITA margin reached \(8.8\%\) (vs consensus at \(8.6\%\) and our estimate of \(8.4\%\) ). Overall adjusted EBITA declined by \(11\%\) YoY to RMB45.7bn (vs our estimate at RMB45.3bn). Non- GAAP net income attributable to shareholders reached RMB35.3bn, vs consensus and our estimate at RMB37.6bn and RMB33.9bn, respectively. Capital expenditure reached RMB38.7bn during the quarter

Key takeaways from conference call. (1) China Ecommerce. (a) CMR growth in Jun quarter was driven by take rate, which was mainly due to (i) \(0.6\%\) service fee, and (ii) further penetration of QZT. These positive impacts will continue in coming quarters. Quick Commerce has positive impact on CMR. CMR will maintain fast growth in the coming quarters. (b) No. of 88VIP grew by double digits YoY, surpassing 53m. (2) Quick commerce. BABA achieves its first- stage goal for quick commerce, which is to scale up user growth and build consumer mind share. It expects quick commerce to generate RMB1tn incremental GMV within the next three years. (a) Order volume. Daily order volume of quick commerce peaked at 120m, and weekly average daily order reached 80m in Aug. (b) User scale. Monthly active consumers (MAC) of quick commerce reached 300m in Aug, representing \(200\%\) growth vs before Apr.

Investment Thesis / Where We Differ- Alibaba has multiple growth drivers for the years ahead, in our view, with its core marketplace a strong cash cow that enjoys secular growth momentum amid a consumption upgrade in China, thanks to solid execution and technological strength in digitalizing the retail sector with enhanced efficiencies.- Its highly synergistic ecosystem enables it to ramp up in lower- tier cities and offer local services.- In cloud computing, it has clear market leadership as the backbone of digitalization across different industries.- Alibaba is at the center of the consumption- driven economy and online shopping, supported by its strong technological strength vs. peers.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Base Case, \(\) 165, + 38\%\$ - Tmall market share gain, backed by consumer insights and marketing solutions, is a sustainable long- term growth story with sizable monetization opportunities, driven by paid click growth on better conversion rate and relevant content.- Monetization of recommended feeds is still in the early stages, and we view penetration of lower- tier cities as a top priority for user base expansion and wallet share gain, given its support of quality merchants with value- for- money offerings.- Base case PT of US\$165 (HK\$160) based on SOTP valuation.

Upside Scenario, \(\) 198, + 66\%\$ - Acceleration in online retail growth from macro recovery.- More controlled sales and marketing in lower- tier cities, with rational competition.- Monetization of newsfeeds is above market expectations.- Upside PT of US\$198 (HK\$192) based on SOTP valuation.

Downside Scenario, \(\) 75, - 37\%\$ - Unexpected slowdown in consumption amid macro headwinds.- Aggressive sales and marketing for lower- tier city penetration and food delivery due to intensifying competition.- Monetization of news feeds is below market expectations.- Downside PT of US\$75 (HK\$72.5) based on SOTP valuation.

Sustainability Matters- Top Material Issue(s): 1) a pandemic security and customer privacy. Privacy protection and data security measures are important for a technology company. Alibaba needs to develop and use technology ethically and maintain the trust of partners, customers, counterparties. 2) Product Design & Lifecycle Management. As an ecommerce platform, company promotes help for consumers to improve their living standards and provide consumers with diverse, inclusive, trustworthy, and responsible consumption.

Company Target(s): 1) Aiming to achieve carbon neutrality in operations by 2030. 2) Aiming to reduce carbon emission intensity by 50% through collaboration with upstream and downstream partners at the value chain by 2030. 3) To take lead in achieving carbon neutrality in cloud computing and become a green cloud; leverage the power of platform to facilitate a reduction of 1.5 gigatons of carbon emissions in 15 years. 4) Implementing the ten Principles of the UN Global Compact.
Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are you investing in to protect your firm and your customer data? 2) What is the financial impact of implementing ESG strategy?
Catalysts- Stronger-than- expected recommendation feed ad monetization.- Earlier-than- expected breakeven at New Retail, Ele.me, or Lazada.- Stronger-than- expected GMV growth.

(c) Merchant supply. The rapid growth in business scale attracts new merchants to onboard Taobao Instant Commerce. High-quality merchant supply has reached industry-leading levels. It is actively onboarding Tmall brands' offline sites to Taobao Instant Commerce, enabling one-stop online-offline operation for Tmall brands. EABA expects to onboard about 1m branded offline stores over time. (d) Riders. Daily active riders have exceeded 2m, 3x higher vs Apr, which means it creates over 1m new jobs. (e) Lightning warehouses. It has over 50K lightning warehouses with order growth of over 360% YoY, 25% of which comes from supply chains within the Alibaba ecosystem. (f) Synergies with e-commerce business. Quick commerce is a significant driver to overall user scale and engagement. In Aug, quick commerce drove 25% growth in the Taobao app's MAU. E-commerce benefits from quick commerce in: (i) advertising and CMR driven by traffic growth; (ii) savings in S&M expenses as a result of increased user activity. (g) UE can be improved by optimization of customer mix, order mix, as well as fulfillment efficiency and costs. In the short run, BABA expects UE losses can be narrowed by half with logistics and subsidy efficiency improvements and order structure optimization. In the long term, it believes quick commerce will bring sustained positive economic value to the overall platform while maintaining price competitiveness. (3) AIDC. (a) AIDC achieves solid progress and approaches breakeven while sustaining strong growth momentum. (b) Strong AIDC growth was driven by the strong performance of cross border business. (c) With improvement of operational efficiency, Choice and Trendyol have UE improvement sequentially in the quarter. (d) Going forward, BABA will improve operational as well as efficiencies to improve profitability. (4) AI. It highlights that LLM are evolving from chatbots into agent which handles long context and complex tasks, creating new opportunities for infrastructure provider. As a cloud vendor, Alibaba is well positioned with broad industry coverage, sandbox environments (e.g.new product AgentBay) and continuous model upgrades to support agent adoption. Strong coding and system integration capabilities are seen as critical to solving highly customized enterprise tasks, while Alibaba's broader ecosystem (such as Taobao, Amap, and Alipay) provides additional tools to automate workflows and embed agents into real business scenarios. (5) Cloud. The growth of Alibaba Cloud mainly comes from (a) high demand for training and reasoning since enterprises have more use cases and shift traditional workloads to LLM capabilities. (b) Enterprises have strong demand for post-training, especially in verticals like automotive, media, and healthcare. Management expects China's cloud market to concentrate to a few players, favoring vendors with full stack capabilities across traditional cloud computing, compute storage, AI compute and models. Its priority is to grow user base and expand into more use cases instead of short-term margins. Management reaffirmed its RMB380bn three- year AI investment plan, with flexibility for quarterly fluctuations due to supply or policy changes.

Valuation and risks. We reiterate our Buy rating and adjust our PT to US\(165/HK\)160 (prior US\)150/HK\)145) as we roll forward our estimates and factor in a better than outlook post result. Key risks include (1) severe macroeconomic slowdown impacts online shopping growth; (2) user growth falls below expectations; and (3) company faces a stringent regulatory environment across different sub- sectors.
Exhibit 1 - BABA US: Income Statement
Source: Company, Jefferies estimates
Exhibit 2 - BABA US: Balance Sheet
Source: Company, Jefferies estimates
Exhibit 3-BABA US:Cash Flow Statement
Source: Company, Jefferies estimates

We would like to thank Fiona Fan, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report. We would like to thank Han Wang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report We would like to thank Erica Qiu, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Alibaba is the largest online and mobile commerce company in the world in terms of gross merchandise volume in 2013, according to industry sources. The company operates its marketplaces as platforms for third parties and does not engage in direct sales, compete with merchants, or hold inventory.

Our price target of US \(165 / HK\) 160 is based on SOTP valuation. Key risks include (1) severe macroeconomic slowdown impacts online shopping growth; (2) aggressive marketing spending in local services and globalization due to intensified competition; and (3) user growth falls below expectations.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations. Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
